intro: Cathartolinum arenicola, commonly known as the sand-pit plant, is a rare and specialized flora species adapted to arid and sandy environments. It possesses a compact growth form with small, fleshy leaves that help reduce water loss. The plant produces delicate, yellowish flowers that bloom during the brief rainy season. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to anchor in loose, nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Cathartolinum arenicola is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts.
